image.altText: Lando Norris driving his McLaren during Australian Formula One Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's hopes of winning the Australian Grand Prix have been dashed after spinning out while running second. Follow live.

title.children: Piastri spins late as teammate Norris claims dramatic Australian Grand Prix

image.altText: A cargo ship at sea with many colourful containers.

props.synopsis: If the events of the past few weeks have proven anything, it is that free trade agreements are worthless, at least when it comes to trade.

title.children: How America ripped off Australia with 'free trade'

image.altText: A solar system on a rooftop at sunset.

props.synopsis: Once, governments stumbled over themselves to shower money on rooftop solar owners. No longer â€” payments have tanked up to 99.93 per cent for exports.

title.children: Solar feed-tariffs plummet, but 'the stuff you use is very, very valuable'

image.altText: A sunrise in Sydney with the Sydney Harbour Bridge in view

props.synopsis: An overnight temperatures of almost 26 degrees was recorded overnight in Sydney's CBD, marking the warmest March night in 149 years.

title.children: 'Even hotter than Singapore': Steamy Sydney night breaks 149-year record

image.altText: Gout Gout running at the Queensland Championships.

props.synopsis: Gout Gout breaks 20 seconds for the 200 metres, but his time will not stand as a national record due to the assistance of an illegal wind reading.

title.children: Gout Gout dips under 20 seconds for 200m with illegal tailwind

image.altText: A close up image of Adam Bandt in Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Adam Bandt calls on the government to distance itself from the United States and explore other relationships, as Trade Minister Don Farrell admits his American counterpart gave him no assurances about possible future tariffs.Â

title.children: 'We should get out of AUKUS': Greens leader urges end to deal with 'very dangerous' Trump

image.altText: Astronauts wearing blue jumpsuits and red shirts hugging each other while floating in orbit on the ISS

props.synopsis: A SpaceX rescue mission destined for the International Space Station (ISS) has been successful and aims to return two astronauts who have been stranded in orbit since June 2024.

title.children: SpaceX mission docks with the ISS to relieve stranded astronauts

image.altText: Anthony Albanese stands behind a lectern looking stern.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese has reiterated Australia's support for Ukraine after attending a virtual meeting with other world leaders to drum up support for ceasefire discussions.

title.children: Labor and Coalition reiterate opposing stances on Ukraine peacekeeping

image.altText: Christian Petracca smiles while hugging Tom Sparrow in celebration of a goal

props.synopsis: Christian Petracca and Clayton Oliver have both showcased their class in their long-awaited returns to the Demons side in a blockbuster clash against the Giants. Follow live.

title.children: Petracca back to his best with Dees and Giants locked in thriller

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Welcome back Trac! Petracca with a beauty!

image.altText: Lachlan Galvin celebrates

props.synopsis: The Eels and Wests Tigers both need victories to bounce back after round one defeats in the NRL. Later, the Gold Coast Titans belatedly get their season underway against the Bulldogs at Belmore. Follow live.

title.children: Sensational Tigers tries either side of half-time light up NRL clash

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Half time: Late tries give Wests Tigers the lead

image.altText: Trump holds up the executive order while his commerce secretary stands behind him with a grin

props.synopsis: Almost 50 years ago, American wine faced its first David vs Goliath moment against Europe. Now the pair are bracing for their next big battle.

title.children: Europe and the US are in the midst of a wine war. It's not their first

image.altText: Donald Trump's tie is blown by the wind as he descends the stairs from Air Force One.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump had invoked the Alien Enemies Act of 1798, a sweeping wartime authority that would have allowed him broader leeway to speed up mass deportations, on the basis that the US was being "invaded" by a Venezuelan gang.

title.children: Trump's use of 18th-century law to speed up deportations blocked by judge

image.altText: a man in a black suit and red tie punches through a blue swirl

props.synopsis:
Checking facts is as old as journalism and Donald Trump's political rise has underscored its value. So why have media organisations like Meta changed tack?

Â

title.children: Trump told the 'lie of the year' in 2024. Now fewer people are keeping watch

image.altText: Sign at anti-salmon farming event at Verona Sands beach.

props.synopsis: A month on from salmon chunks washing ashore, opponents to industrial fish farming have gathered at the site to repeat their call for the practice to be stopped â€” with Tasmania's Premier adamant a "majority" still support the industry.

title.children: Premier again backs salmon farms as protesters take to site of dead fish wash up

image.altText: A couple with their premature baby

props.synopsis: As Tropical Cyclone Alfred neared the Queensland coast, toppling trees and downing powerlines, more than 2000 health workers in the state's south bunkered down in hospitals to ensure patients were well cared for.Â

title.children: Mum thanks hospital staff after cyclone keeps her from her baby

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Two Indigenous women smile at the camera in a composite image that includes a black and white photo and red desert.

props.synopsis: It has been more than 40 years since the Pintupi Nine made contact with the modern world. Much has changed in their lives, but their country has never stopped calling them home.Â

title.children: For years, these sisters didn't know white people existed

image.altText: President Donald Trump speaks on the phone with Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull.

props.synopsis: When a malignant force bears down on the country, Australians have shown a tendency to swing behind the leader.Â

title.children: Trump's message to Australia redefines 'mateship' as true allies re-emerge

props.synopsis: Trade wars, strongmen, and economic chaos. The world has seen this before.

title.children: Trade wars, strongmen, and economic chaos at a critical time for Australia

image.altText: The exterior of a building from the street with a sign hanging off the front.

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump slashes funding to a government agency that houses multiple media organisations including Voice of America, Radio Free Asia and Radio Free Europe.

title.children: 'Massive gift to America's enemies': US cuts government media funding

image.altText: A man with strawberry blonde hair looks at the camera with a serious face.

props.synopsis: Two years ago, former NBL player Harry Froling was laying in a hospital bed fighting for his life. Now he's set on coming back better than ever.

title.children: After a sickening one-punch attack, Harry Froling was told he'd never play basketball again

image.altText: An emotional Maximo Napa standing alongside his son and a female military officer speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: Peruvian fisherman Maximo Napa Castro has been rescued in the Pacific Ocean after first setting off for a two-week fishing trip and ending up missing and adrift for 95 days.

title.children: Man missing at sea for months survived by 'eating roaches, birds, turtles'

image.altText: Trees are alight and flames and orange smoke can be seen in the bush at night.

props.synopsis: A fire burning near Mount Dandenong overnight destroyed one home and damaged another, with 200 firefighters continuing to battle the blaze on Sunday morning.

title.children: Major fire in Melbourne's east under control after razing one home

image.altText: Twisted, buckled timbers and rails on a sandy road rising from the sea through bush.

props.synopsis: From thriving businesses to "ghost towns", mainland and K'gari (Fraser Island) tourism â€” worth $900 million to the local economy â€” faces a bleak Easter after the storm's damaging deluge.

title.children: Hard road ahead for Hervey Bay tourism in wake of Alfred devastation

props.synopsis: We asked Mark Mattson, an American neuroscientist who has studied intermittent fasting for the last 25 years, about what goes inside our body when we are fasting.

title.children: How fasting can switch on the body's cell recycling system

image.altText: An aerial view of a house is destroyed by storm with lots of debris

props.synopsis: A massive storm system moving across the country has triggered deadly dust storms, tornadoes and fanned more than 100 wildfires.

title.children: At least 26 killed by storms and tornadoes in US as extreme weather threatens millions

image.altText: A group of Yemeni men and boys hold up rifles in protest as they shout slogans.

props.synopsis: The strikes are the first to hit Yemen since the Gaza ceasefire deal took effect in January, and signal a more aggressive approach from the US, which has previously limited its actions to degrading the Houthis' ability to carry out missile and drone attacks.

title.children: Trump orders strikes on Yemen's capital over attacks on Red Sea shipping

image.altText: Two boats can be seen searching along the river.

props.synopsis: Authorities are searching for a 23-year-old man after he slipped into Brisbane River early this morning, failing to resurface.

title.children: Police scouring Brisbane River for man in his 20s

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair

props.synopsis: Wendy Williams tossed a note pleading for help from the window of the assisted care facility where she's been living for three years, reopening a debate about legal guardianships in the US.Â

title.children: This TV host is under a Britney-style guardianship. She's pleading for help

image.altText: A mugshot style photo of a man in his twenties in a tshirt

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation reveals police may have failed to identify another victim of convicted healthcare killer Garry Davis, who was found guilty of murdering two nursing home residents and attempting to kill a third by injecting them with lethal doses of insulin.

title.children: Retired detective queries police investigation of aged care killer

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie, speaking to media.

props.synopsis: Queensland will introduce tougher child protection measures by the end of the year, taking action on the state government's election promise to Daniel Morcombe's parents.

title.children: 'Brave little boy' inspires Queensland crackdown on child safety

image.altText: Robery Dwyer smiling with glasses on and a pink shirt

props.synopsis:
The Liberals hold a tight lead against the Nationals in Port Macquarie's state by-election and an election analyst says they're very likely to win.

Â

title.children: Liberals 'likely to win' rare Coalition clash in Port Macquarie by-election

image.altText: A wing mirror on a car showing a hand on a driving wheel in the reflection.

props.synopsis: Tom takes medicinal cannabis for a bowel condition, but now he is weighing up his options because of a fine he copped for driving with THC in his system.

title.children: Calls for change after driver not at fault in crash charged by police

image.altText: A woman uses virtual reality sticks to navigate an AI situation in virtual reality goggles.

props.synopsis: A training program to help combat a "national crisis" of rising hospital violence puts emergency department workers into situations with virtual aggressive patients.

title.children: Virtual 'code black' pits hospital staff against nightmare patient
